contentrichtext.text: '''Quothquan''' (also formerly spelled '''Couth-Boan''') ([[Scots Gaelic|Gaelic]]: ''A’ Choitcheann'', pronounced {{IPA-gd|ə xɔʰtʲçən̪ˠ|}}) is a village in Libberton parish, [[South Lanarkshire]], [[Scotland]].<ref>{{cite web |title=A Topographical Dictionary of Scotland (1846), pp. 396-399. |url=http://www.british-history.ac.uk/report.aspx?compid=43473 |accessdate=2008-01-13}}</ref> It is located at {{gbmappingsmall|NS994395}}, 3 km north-west of [[Biggar, South Lanarkshire|Biggar]], and 6 km south-east of [[Lanark]]. To the south-west is the 335m high Quothquan Law, topped by the remains of a [[hill fort]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.rcahms.gov.uk/pls/portal/newcanmore.newcandig_details_gis?inumlink=47465 |title=Quothquan Law, NMRS number NS93NE 11 |publisher=[[RCAHMS]] |accessdate=2008-01-15}}</ref> The name is derived from Gaelic and translates as ''The Common''. ==References== {{reflist}} {{coord|55.63861|-3.59972|type:landmark_region:GB_source:enwiki-osgb36(NS994395)|display=title}} {{South Lanarkshire Settlements}} [[Category:Villages in South Lanarkshire]] {{SouthLanarkshire-geo-stub}}
